title: Bublik brings Gasquet‚Äôs Marseille career to a close, Borges defeats Wawrinka
description: Alexander Bublik summoned a bit of d√©j√† vu to end the Open 13 Provence career of a crowd favourite on Tuesday afternoon in Marseille. The Kazakhstani overcame Richard Gasquet 6-4, 6-4 at the indoor ATP 250 to register his 100th tour-level win on hard courts. Bublik crucially broke Gasquet‚Äôs serve in the penultimate game of each set, and on both occasions he served out the next game to love en route to an 82-minute first-round win. After falling behind 0-3 early, Bublik dialled in on serve and produced an all-around aggressive display in which he finished with 37 winners, including 13 aces. The No. 48 in the PIF ATP Rankings completed his win having converted three of five break points he earned, according to Infosys ATP Stats. üéØ Lucky No. 13 Alexander Bublik seals the win over Richard Gasquet 6-4 6-4 with his 13th ace of the match, powering into the second round in Marseille@Open13 | #O13Provence pic.twitter.com/jgO4ZslRNF ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 11, 2025 A former World No. 7, Gasquet remains the youngest match winner in event history in Marseille, where he defeated Feliciano Lopez as a 16-year-old in 2003. Now 38 years old, the Frenchman was on Tuesday bidding to mark his final appearance at the event by also become the oldest match winner in tournament history, but he was unable to stick with Bublik once the Kazakhstani settled into the match. ‚ÄúHe has a spectacular career, 20 years on Tour and 1,012 matches. I don‚Äôt think I would ever get to that point,‚Äù said Bublik of Gasquet, who will retire after this year‚Äôs Roland Garros. ‚ÄúI guess it has to be a great feeling to play your last Marseille after so many years. I wish him a great retirement. He has a couple more events, but this isn‚Äôt about me now. He‚Äôs a legend of French tennis and I wish him a lot of luck.‚Äù The four-time ATP Tour champion Bublik will next take on another French star in second seed and defending champion Ugo Humbert. It will be the second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting between the pair, after Humbert triumphed in the 2024 Dubai championship match. Portugal's Nuno Borges denied Stan Wawrinka his first win of the season after earning a comeback 6-7(4), 7-6(1), 6-3 victory. It is the first time Borges has won a match at an indoor tour-level event since October 2023 in Antwerp, and the 27-year-old is also the first Portuguese match winner in tournament history. The eighth seed reached the semi-finals in Auckland earlier this year, losing to Zizou Bergs. Borges will have the opportunity to gain revenge against the Belgian when they meet in the second round in Marseille. Bergs defeated Frenchman Clement Chidekh earlier on Day 2 at the ATP 250. Daniel Altmaier, Luca Van Assche and Jan-Lennard Struff were also early winners on Tuesday in Marseille. Germany's Altmaier eased past Luca Nardi 6-2, 6-2 to set a second-round meeting with Otto Virtanen, while Van Assche saved two match points in the deciding-set tie-break to prevail 3-6, 6-3, 7-6(7) in an all French battle against Benjamin Bonzi. With his first tour-level win of 2025, the 20-year-old Van Assche advanced to face seventh seed Lorenzo Sonego. Struff, 34, beat Frenchman Manuel Guinard 7-5, 7-6(4). The German struck 18 aces according to Infosys ATP Stats to advance after one hour and 59 minutes. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

I wish him a great retirement. He has a couple more events, but this isn‚Äôt about me now. The eighth seed reached the semi-finals in Auckland earlier this year, losing to Zizou Bergs. Germany's Altmaier eased past Luca Nardi 6-2, 6-2 to set a second-round meeting with Otto Virtanen, while Van Assche saved two match points in the deciding-set tie-break to prevail 3-6, 6-3, 7-6(7) in an all French battle against Benjamin Bonzi. With his first tour-level win of 2025, the 20-year-old Van Assche advanced to face seventh seed Lorenzo Sonego. Struff, 34, beat Frenchman Manuel Guinard 7-5, 7-6(4). The German struck 18 aces according to Infosys ATP Stats to advance after one hour and 59 minutes.
html:
Marseille

Bublik brings Gasquet‚Äôs Marseille career to a close, Borges defeats Wawrinka

Struff, Van Assche, Altmaier advance at ATP 250

February 11, 2025

Corinne Dubreuil | Open 13

Alexander Bublik defeats Richard Gasquet on Tuesday at the Open 13 Provence in Marseille. By ATP Staff

Alexander Bublik summoned a bit of d√©j√† vu to end the Open 13 Provence career of a crowd favourite on Tuesday afternoon in Marseille.

The Kazakhstani overcame Richard Gasquet 6-4, 6-4 at the indoor ATP 250 to register his 100th tour-level win on hard courts. Bublik crucially broke Gasquet‚Äôs serve in the penultimate game of each set, and on both occasions he served out the next game to love en route to an 82-minute first-round win.

After falling behind 0-3 early, Bublik dialled in on serve and produced an all-around aggressive display in which he finished with 37 winners, including 13 aces. The No. 48 in the PIF ATP Rankings completed his win having converted three of five break points he earned, according to Infosys ATP Stats.

‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 11, 2025

A former World No. 7, Gasquet remains the youngest match winner in event history in Marseille, where he defeated Feliciano Lopez as a 16-year-old in 2003. Now 38 years old, the Frenchman was on Tuesday bidding to mark his final appearance at the event by also become the oldest match winner in tournament history, but he was unable to stick with Bublik once the Kazakhstani settled into the match.

‚ÄúHe has a spectacular career, 20 years on Tour and 1,012 matches. I don‚Äôt think I would ever get to that point,‚Äù said Bublik of Gasquet, who will retire after this year‚Äôs Roland Garros. ‚ÄúI guess it has to be a great feeling to play your last Marseille after so many years. I wish him a great retirement. He has a couple more events, but this isn‚Äôt about me now. He‚Äôs a legend of French tennis and I wish him a lot of luck.‚Äù

The four-time ATP Tour champion Bublik will next take on another French star in second seed and defending champion Ugo Humbert. It will be the second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting between the pair, after Humbert triumphed in the 2024 Dubai championship match.

Portugal's Nuno Borges denied Stan Wawrinka his first win of the season after earning a comeback 6-7(4), 7-6(1), 6-3 victory. It is the first time Borges has won a match at an indoor tour-level event since October 2023 in Antwerp, and the 27-year-old is also the first Portuguese match winner in tournament history.

The eighth seed reached the semi-finals in Auckland earlier this year, losing to Zizou Bergs. Borges will have the opportunity to gain revenge against the Belgian when they meet in the second round in Marseille. Bergs defeated Frenchman Clement Chidekh earlier on Day 2 at the ATP 250.

Daniel Altmaier, Luca Van Assche and Jan-Lennard Struff were also early winners on Tuesday in Marseille. Germany's Altmaier eased past Luca Nardi 6-2, 6-2 to set a second-round meeting with Otto Virtanen, while Van Assche saved two match points in the deciding-set tie-break to prevail 3-6, 6-3, 7-6(7) in an all French battle against Benjamin Bonzi. With his first tour-level win of 2025, the 20-year-old Van Assche advanced to face seventh seed Lorenzo Sonego.

Struff, 34, beat Frenchman Manuel Guinard 7-5, 7-6(4). The German struck 18 aces according to Infosys ATP Stats to advance after one hour and 59 minutes.
